content:
The webhook will be deleted permanently.
You will not be able to undo this action.

comment.text: This translation key is used for a warning message that appears when a user attempts to delete a webhook. The message informs them of the permanent nature of the deletion and prevents them from undoing the action. It is displayed in a modal dialog when the "Delete" button is clicked in the Delete Webhook Dialog component.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "geri qaytara bilməzsiniz" is a literal translation of "cannot undo" but sounds slightly unnatural in Azerbaijani for this context. A more natural phrasing would be "Bu hərəkəti arxa keçirməyəcəksiniz" or "Bu hərəkəti ləğv etməyəcəksiniz".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Webhook həmişəlik silinəcək. Bu hərəkəti arxa keçirməyəcəksiniz.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'webhook' is transliterated as 'Webhook-ը'. While technically acceptable, it's more common to simply use 'վեբհուքը' for consistency and readability.

The Armenian sentence structure 'Դուք չեք կարողանա հետարկել այս գործողությունը:' is grammatically correct, but slightly formal. A more conversational and natural phrasing could improve user experience.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Դուք չեք կարող հետ դառնալ այս գործողությունը:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term "Tīmekļa aizķere" is not the correct translation of 'webhook'. The accurate term would be 'webhook' or a descriptive phrase like 'vietnes atbalstības saņēmējs'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace "Tīmekļa aizķere" with "webhook" or "vietnes atbalstības saņēmējs".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While the rest of the translation is understandable, 'neatgriezeniski izdzēsta' is a bit clunky. A more natural phrasing could improve readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "tiks neatgriezeniski izdzēsts" or "tiks izdzēsts bez atgriešanas iespējas".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'șters' (deleted) is a bit abrupt. 'Eliminat' (removed) or 'înlăturat' (removed) might be more appropriate for a user-facing message in a professional context.
While 'Această acțiune nu poate fi anulată' is technically correct, a more user-friendly phrasing would emphasize the permanence and loss of data.

The translation uses a full stop/period at the end of each sentence. While acceptable, it might be more consistent with typical UI text to use an ellipsis (...) instead, especially in a warning message. This is stylistic but improves readability in some contexts.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 此 webhook 将被永久删除。... 您无法撤消此操作...
